question: What happens when the federal government loses a confidence vote?
possible_answers: B. The official opposition party takes power.
C. The Prime Minister loses his job.
D. The Prime Minister is no longer the leader of his party.
main_question: What happens when the federal government loses a confidence vote?
explanatory_sentence: When the House of Commons votes on a major issue such as the budget, this is considered a matter of confidence. If a majority of the members of the House of Commons vote against a major government decision, the party in power is defeated, which usually results in the Prime Minister asking the Governor General, on behalf of the Sovereign, to call an election.
